text: head down,look down,lower head,lower your head
who=Luis,when=.5,do=say:Welcome teacher, we're glad that you're here today.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt
who=Jazmin,when=6,do=say:In the next six minutes, we are going to give you a tour of our classroom+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt
who=Chris,when=11,do=say:and we will answer the question on the board. When was this photograph taken?+var:1,2,3,4,5
who=Farrah,when=13,do=Our responses will help you learn more about our thinking+var:1,2,3,4,5
who=Luis,when=15,do=say:Before we get started let's take a couple deep breaths together.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt

who=Farrah,when=19,do=say:Breathe in through your nose, hold your breath, now breathe out. Go ahead and take another breath. Breathing helps us relax and learn from our practice.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt

who=Jazmin,when=34,do=say:Teacher, Click on the pencil icon on the toolbar and circle details in the image that may tell you when the photograph was taken.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt+slide:0TruthPic+camera:0,150,500,0,0,0,0,0+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt
who=Luis,when=55,do=say:Thanks teacher, we can see your ideas about when this photograph was taken, now we'd like to share our ideas.+var:1,2,3,4,5+close:blackboard
who=Farrah,when=64,do=say:We'd like to show you our Domino Discover routine - today we will each share our name and when we think the photograph was taken.+var:1,2,3,4,5
who=Oliver,when=74,do=say:I'm Oliver, It looks like it was taken a long time ago.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt
who=Chris,when=79,do=say:I'm Chris, You can see she's dressed the way people were during slavery time.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt
who=Farrah,when=85,do=say:I'm Farrah, Maybe in the olden days?+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt
who=Luis,when=90,do=say:I'm Luis, The title underneath says Sojourner Truth. She was alive hundreds of years ago.+var:1,2,3,4,5
who=Farrah,when=108,do=say:Look on the blackboard. You can see the answers that we just shared.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt+slide:0Remarks1+slide:1Remarks2

who=Chris,when=116,do=say:Ask us about our answers by pressing the space bar and asking us the clarifying question, What makes you say that? or ask us to tell you about the details we see.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt+slide:Deep+slide:0Deep1

who=Oliver,when=125,do=say:You can reflect back what you heard us say in our responses with a statement that starts with "You noticed", or "You are bringing"+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt+slide:0Question1+slide:1Deep2
who=Sharleen,when=132,do=say:Reflecting back our responses confirms that you understood our response+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt+slide:0Question1+slide:1Question2
who=Farrah,when=233,do=prompt:5 seconds to finish your clarifying questions and reflections!"+var:1,2,3,4,5

who=Chris,when=238,do=say:It's time for us to go to our next class, but before we go, click on the graph in the toolbar to see a timeline of our lesson and our interactions+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt
who=Luis,when=247,do=say:Look for the green line to see the type of feedback you used to interact with us.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt
who=Oliver,when=252,do=say:The green line shows your clarify question, What makes you say that and statements that Reflect back to us what we shared with you+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt
who=Jazmin,when=261,do=say:Click on a colored dot see the differences in our responses.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt
who=Chris,when=267,do=say:At the end of this session you can press the play button to replay a recording of your interactions with us.+var:1,2,3,4,5+act:interrupt

who=Luis,when=286,do=say:Now, you can use what you learned to join us in another lesson where we explore more deeply the meaning of this primary source and you can practice more teaching strategies that nurture deeper learning .+var:1,2,3,4,5+close:graph
who=Sharleen,when=297,do=say:Click on the notebook in the toolbar to download more teaching resources+var:1,2,3,4,5
who=Farrah,when=317,do=say:You can practice more and print a participation certificate after this survey.+var:1,2,3,4,5+assess:poll4

id: Discover Student Thinking About the Portrait
text: Engage the Student,Students state purpose: "We will answer the question on the board so you learn more about our thinking.",Breathe: "Letâ€™s breathe in - hold the breath - then breathe out.",Listen: Students share their thinking during the Domino Discover routine.+Understand Student Thinking,Step 1a. Clarify: "When do you think this photograph was taken?",Step 1b. Clarify: "What makes you say that?" or "Tell us more about the details you see.",Step 2. Reflect: "You are noticing details in the picture." or "You are using your knowledge or experiences to guide your thinking."+End Simulation,Stop: An alert will tell you simulation is ending.,Reflect: Complete our survey.,Print: Certificate (if you want one)+Technology Tips,Allow agileteacherlab.org to access your microphone.,Press spacebar to speak. You will see your words transcribed in the toolbar.,Type your words in the toolbar if you have trouble with your microphone.
